dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The NewSegment tool is a Python geoprocessing tool that is launched from ArcMap when the user adds a new feature during an edit session. The dialog box for the tool provides field input from numerous tables in the NJ Road Centerline database.

It is important to note that this tool launches AFTER a new segment is added, which means that if the user would like to cancel adding a new segment they must "cancel" this tool and then undo the new segment operation.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Author: NJ Office of Information Technology, Office of GIS. Support: njgin@oit.state.nj.us Bugs: email support, subject: "NJ Road Editor Add-In"

Consts.useLimit: This tool is licenced under the GPLv3 license. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses.

tool.name: NewSegment

param.name: SEG_ID
param.dialogReference: Currently disabled. SEG_ID is deprecated.

param.name: Create Entry in SEG_NAME
param.displayname: Create Entry in SEG_NAME and SEGMENT.PRIME_NAME
param.dialogReference:
User must check or uncheck this box.

If unchecked, the SEG_NAME category will be disabled and no new record will be inserted into the SEG_NAME table.

If checked the SEG_NAME category will be enabled, and user input is required. This will insert a new record into the SEG_NAME table with the user input and the newly assigned SEG_GUID. Also, the NAME_FULL that is built will inherit through to the PRIME_NAME field in SEGMENT. This eliminates the need for manual input into PRIME_NAME and ensures that it matches with NAME_FULL.

If SYMBOL_TYPE_ID is a ramp, then SEG_NAME fields will be disabled.

param.name: ADDR_L_FR
param.dialogReference:
Starting address on the left side of the road.

If the SYMBOL_TYPE_ID is a ramp, then addresses will not be enabled for input.

param.name: ADDR_L_TO
param.dialogReference:
Ending address on the left side of the road.

If the SYMBOL_TYPE_ID is a ramp, then addresses will not be enabled for input.

param.name: ADDR_R_FR
param.dialogReference:
Starting address on the left right of the road.

If the SYMBOL_TYPE_ID is a ramp, then addresses will not be enabled for input.

param.name: ADDR_R_TO
param.dialogReference:
Ending address on the right side of the road.

If the SYMBOL_TYPE_ID is a ramp, then addresses will not be enabled for input.

param.name: ZIPCODE_L
param.dialogReference: Zipcode on the left side of the road. Must be 5 digits long.

param.name: ZIPCODE_R
param.dialogReference: Zipcode on the right side of the road. Must be 5 digits long.

param.name: ZIPNAME_L
param.dialogReference: Zipcode name on the left side of the road.

param.name: ZIPNAME_R
param.dialogReference: Zipcode name on the right side of the road.

param.dialogReference: Municipal ID for the right side of the road.

param.name: ELEV_TYPE_ID_FR
param.dialogReference: Elevation type ID at the start of the road.

param.name: ELEV_TYPE_ID_TO
param.dialogReference: Elevation type ID at the end of the road.

param.name: ACC_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference: Access type.

param.name: SURF_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference: Surface type.

param.name: STATUS_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference: Status type.

param.name: SYMBOL_TYPE_ID
param.expression: Highway Authority Route | Highway Authority Ramp | Interstate | Insterstate Ramp | US Highway | US Highway Ramp | State Highway | State Highway Ramp | County 500 Route | County 500 Ramp | Other County Route | Other County Ramp | Local Road | Local Ramp | Alley
param.dialogReference: Symbol type.

param.name: TRAVEL_DIR_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference:
Travel direction type.

If SYMBOL_TYPE_ID is a ramp, then TRAVEL_DIR cannot be 'both'.

param.name: JURIS_TYPE_ID
param.expression: Public | Private | Private (with linear referencing) | Unknown
param.dialogReference:
Jurisdiction type. This can be one of; Public, Private, or Unkown. One additional option is provided ("Private with linear referencing") in order to account for private roads that require linear referencing. If this is selected, the domain will still be "PUB", for Public. "Public" is the default.

If "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)" is selected, the fields in the LINEAR_REF category are enabled and become required.

param.name: OIT_REV_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference: Review type for the NJ Office of Information Technology (OIT).

param.name: DOT_REV_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference: Review type for the NJ Department of Transportation (DOT).

param.name: NAME_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference:
Name type is either "Local" or "Highway". "Local" is the default.

If the user selects "Highway", the fields in SEG_SHIELD category will be enabled and required.

param.name: RANK (SEG_NAME)
param.dialogReference: Rank of the road. Since this is a new segment, this value must be 1 since it will be the highest ranking name in the database. This field is always disabled from user input.

param.name: NAME_FULL
param.dialogReference:
Full non-abbreviated name of the road. This field is always disabled from direct user input. Instead, it is built "on-the-fly" within the tool using the fields; PRE_DIR, PRE_TYPE, PRE_MOD, NAME, SUF_TYPE, SUF_DIR, and SUF_MOD. For this field to build, it needs input from NAME at a minimum.

Examples:

  1. North Delsea Drive

    1. PRE_DIR: North

    2. PRE_TYPE:

    3. PRE_MOD:

    4. NAME: Delsea

    5. SUF_TYPE: Drive

    6. SUF_DIR:

    7. SUF_MOD:

  2. State Highway 83

    1. PRE_DIR:

    2. PRE_TYPE: State Highway

    3. PRE_MOD:

    4. NAME: 83

    5. SUF_TYPE:

    6. SUF_DIR:

    7. SUF_MOD:

  3. Interstate 78 Express

    1. PRE_DIR:

    2. PRE_TYPE: Insterstate

    3. PRE_MOD:

    4. NAME: 78

    5. SUF_TYPE:

    6. SUF_DIR:

    7. SUF_MOD: Express

  4. Old Highway 22

    1. PRE_DIR:

    2. PRE_TYPE:

    3. PRE_MOD: Old

    4. NAME: Highway 22

    5. SUF_TYPE:

    6. SUF_DIR:

    7. SUF_MOD:

  5. Glen Avenue South

    1. PRE_DIR:

    2. PRE_TYPE:

    3. PRE_MOD:

    4. NAME: Glen

    5. SUF_TYPE: Avenue

    6. SUF_DIR: South

    7. SUF_MOD:

param.name: PRE_DIR
param.dialogReference: Prefix direction

param.name: PRE_TYPE
param.dialogReference: Prefix type

param.name: PRE_MOD
param.dialogReference: Prefix modifier

param.name: NAME
param.dialogReference: Name of the road.

param.name: SUF_TYPE
param.dialogReference: Suffix type

param.name: SUF_DIR
param.dialogReference: Suffix direction

param.name: SUF_MOD
param.dialogReference: Suffix modifier

param.name: DATA_SRC_TYPE_ID
param.expression: {NJDOT | Tiger | County | MOD IV | Other | NJOIT | Taxmap}
param.dialogReference: Data source type. The source of the data edit.

param.name: RANK (SEG_SHIELD)
param.dialogReference:
Rank of the road. Since this is a new segment, this value must be 1 since it will be the highest ranking name in the database. This field is always disabled from user input. It will always match the RANK for SEG_NAME.

Only enabled when SEG_NAME NAME_TYPE_ID is "Highway Name".

param.name: SHIELD_TYPE_ID
param.expression: {Atlantic City Expressway | Atlantic City Brigantine Connector | County Route | Garden State Parkway | Interstate | Palisades Interstate Parkway | State Route | NJ Turnpike | US Route}
param.dialogReference:
Shield type.

Only enabled when SEG_NAME NAME_TYPE_ID is "Highway Name".

param.name: SHIELD_SUBTYPE_ID
param.expression: {Alternate Route | Business Route | Connector Route | Express Route | Main Route | Spur Route | Truck Route | Bypass Route}
param.dialogReference:
Shield subtype.

Only enabled when SEG_NAME NAME_TYPE_ID is "Highway Name".

param.name: SHIELD_NAME
param.dialogReference:
Shield Name

Only enabled when SEG_NAME NAME_TYPE_ID is "Highway Name".

param.name: DATA_SRC_TYPE_ID (SEG_SHIELD)
param.expression: {NJDOT | Tiger | County | MOD IV | Other | NJOIT | Taxmap}
param.dialogReference: Data sourse type. Inherits directly from the SEG_NAME DATA_SRC_TYPE_ID, and is always disabled.

param.name: SRI
param.dialogReference:
Standard route identifier (SRI). This is optional.

This field is only enabled when JURIS_TYPE_ID is "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)".

SRI must be 17 characters long if the SYMBOL_TYPE_ID is a ramp

SRI must be 10 characters long if the SYMBOL_TYPE_ID is NOT a ramp, and have "__" in the 9th and 10th position.

param.name: LRS_TYPE_ID
param.expression: NJDOT Multi-Centerline | NJDOT Parent | NJDOT Flipped | MMS Milepost Markers | NJTA
param.dialogReference:
LRS type.

This field is only enabled when JURIS_TYPE_ID is "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)".

param.name: SEG_TYPE_ID
param.expression: Primary | Secondary | Express | Express Secondary | Acceleration/Deceleration
param.dialogReference:
Segment type

This field is only enabled when JURIS_TYPE_ID is "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)".

param.name: MILEPOST_FR
param.dialogReference:
Milepost from. This is the milepost value (floating point) at the "start" of the road segment. This value will be used to populate the M-values of the segment if LRS_TYPE == 1.

This field is only enabled when JURIS_TYPE_ID is "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)".

If LRS_TYPE is NJDOT Multi-Centerline, then MP_FROM must be less than MP_TO, or equal (this is rare).

Milepost values cannot be negative unless SEG_TYPE is "AD".

param.name: MILEPOST_TO
param.dialogReference:
Milepost to. This is the milepost value (floating point) at the "end" of the road segment. This value will be used to populate the M-values of the segment if LRS_TYPE == 1.

This field is only enabled when JURIS_TYPE_ID is "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)".

If LRS_TYPE is NJDOT Multi-Centerline, then MP_FROM must be less than MP_TO, or equal (this is rare).

Milepost values cannot be negative unless SEG_TYPE is "AD".

param.name: RCF
param.dialogReference: Route Change Form. Integer. Optional.

param.name: SRI (SLD)
param.dialogReference:
Standard route identifier (SRI).

This should match the LRS SRI.

SRI must be 17 characters long if the SYMBOL_TYPE_ID is a ramp

SRI must be 10 characters long if the SYMBOL_TYPE_ID is NOT a ramp, and have "__" in the 9th and 10th position.

param.name: ROUTE_TYPE_ID
param.expression: {Interstate | US Route | State Route | Highway Authority Route | 500 Series Route | Other County Route | Local Road | Ramp | Alley | Park / Military}
param.dialogReference:
Route type ID.

This field is only enabled when there is a value in the LINEAR_REF SRI. Also, the user can only populate the LINEAR_REF SRI field when JURIS_TYPE_ID is "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)".

If SEG_TYPE_ID is "AD", then ROUTE_TYPE_ID is "Ramp"

If ROUTE_TYPE is > 7, then SLD_DIRECTION should not have a value.

If ROUTE_TYPE is <= 7, then SLD_DIRECTION should have a value, unless JURIS_TYPE is public & ROUTE_TYPE = 7.

param.name: SLD_NAME
param.dialogReference:
SLD name.

This field is only enabled when there is a value in the LINEAR_REF SRI. Also, the user can only populate the LINEAR_REF SRI field when JURIS_TYPE_ID is "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)".

param.name: SLD_COMMENT
param.dialogReference:
SLD Comment

This field is only enabled when there is a value in the LINEAR_REF SRI. Also, the user can only populate the LINEAR_REF SRI field when JURIS_TYPE_ID is "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)".

param.name: SLD_DIRECTION
param.expression: {North to South | South to North | East to West | West to East}
param.dialogReference:
SLD direction.

This field is only enabled when there is a value in the LINEAR_REF SRI. Also, the user can only populate the LINEAR_REF SRI field when JURIS_TYPE_ID is "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)".

If ROUTE_TYPE is > 7, then SLD_DIRECTION should not have a value.

If ROUTE_TYPE is <= 7, then SLD_DIRECTION should have a value, unless JURIS_TYPE is public & ROUTE_TYPE = 7.

param.name: SIGN_NAME
param.dialogReference:
Sign name.

This field is only enabled when there is a value in the LINEAR_REF SRI. Also, the user can only populate the LINEAR_REF SRI field when JURIS_TYPE_ID is "Public" or "Private (with linear referencing)".

tool.summary:
The NewSegment tool is a Python geoprocessing tool that is launched from ArcMap when the user adds a new feature during an edit session. The dialog box for the tool provides field input from numerous tables in the NJ Road Centerline database.

It is important to note that this tool launches AFTER a new segment is added, which means that if the user would like to cancel adding a new segment they must "cancel" this tool and then undo the new segment operation.
